Planets.name: Mercury
Facts: The closest planet to the Sun is only about as wide as the Atlantic Ocean!
does not have any moons or rings.
It is the smallest planet.
Your weight on Mercury would be 38% of your weight on Earth.
A year on Mercury takes 88 Earth days.

Planets.name: Venus
Facts: The hottest planet in the solar system
has super-powerful winds
Known as the evening or morning star. Yellow clouds made of sulfur and sulfuric acid cover the entire planet causing light to reflect off the surface

Planets.name: Jupiter
Facts: The largest planet in the solar system.
It has more than double the mass of all the other planets combined
It has the shortest day of all the planets
It has a thin ring system

Planets.name: Mars
Facts: The red planet
The largest peak on the red planet is a volcano called Olympus Mons, which is three times higher than Mount Everest!
There are signs of liquid water on Mars
Sunsets on Mars are blue.

Planets.name: Saturn
Facts: the second largest planet and is known for its rings
It has a hexagonal-shaped storm.
The flattest planet
is made mostly of hydrogen
Saturn has more moons than any other planet

Planets.name: Uranus
Facts: Uranus turns on its axis once every 17 hours, 14 minutes
Takes roughly 84 years to orbit once around the Sun!
Orbits on its side, which means that its seasons are completely different to ours. Summer and winter each take 21 years at the north and south poles!

Planets.name: Neptune
Facts: It takes like more than 4 hours for light to reach Neptune from the Sun
It radiates more heat than it gets from the sun.
Neptune spins on its axis very rapidly.
